channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytip, 5th August
item.description:
2 fridges flytipped on corner of petersham drive
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 5th August
item.description:
Resident called report Council contractors came out to do some work and they left behind 4 sacks of rubbish someone has now dumped drawers, clothing pole and other items next to it. Please can we inspect and advise caller.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surlingham Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes/sinking road surface in bus lane., 5th August
item.description:
The vibrations from the ongoing pot holes/sinking road surface in the bus lane on Lordship lane just NW of the junction with Underhill Rd is causing cracks to appear in the fabric of our building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken, 5th August
item.description:
Pavement broken outside 39 petersham drive, concrete dipped down if this can be looked at JW
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress, 5th August
item.description:
Mattress and bucket left blocking whole pavement. This area is a constant dumping ground, blocking pavement access, some are hazardous materials from car repairs, broken glass from street drinking. Please can the council act to deter fly tipping and street drinking in this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mineral Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Concern over fallen tree 177 Lennard Rd, 5th August
item.description:
This fallen tree destroyed a parked car and could have caused fatalities. Looking at the base of the tree, with untutored eyes, it would appear to have been rotten. Lennard Rd is full of large lime trees very close to the houses. Given the state of the fallen tree, I would urge the council to inspect the existing trees and to consider pruning in the autumn. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents dumping rubbish, 5th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkdale Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 5th August

item.title: The street is extremely dirty after the weekend, 5th August
item.description:
Customers of the hospitality venues on the street leave it extremely dirty after the weekend and the street needs to be attended to first thing on Monday morning. It is genuinely hideous to walk through at the moment
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Helmsley Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter scattered, 5th August
item.description:
After collecting the rubbish, the cleaners leave the bags on the pavement overnight. Foxes tear them open and scatter the garbage. ^^^Please organise the cleaners’ work so that the bags are not left outside overnight.^^^

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rope Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
